channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Signing Credit-Card Receipts Is Pointless. Why Do We Still Do It?
item.description: Signatures have been optional since 2018, even on restaurant checks.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Start Week Lower
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures moved lower as a pickup in production offsets added demand from the return of Cove Point LNG after maintenance, while October...

item.title: Longboard Pharmaceuticals’ stock soars amid Lundbeck’s $2.6 billion deal to acquire the company
item.description: H. Lundbeck plans to acquire Longboard Pharmaceuticals in a $2.6 billion deal, the companies announced Monday.

item.title: Euro Bank Bond Supply Likely to be Limited Ahead of ECB Rate Decision
item.description: Eurozone bond yields eased as investors anticipate ECB rate cuts this week, DHF Capital S.A. said. The U.S. bond market is closed Monday for a holiday...

item.title: Oil prices slump after China offers little detail on stimulus plans
item.description: Oil futures slumped Monday, poised to give back nearly all of last week’s gains after a weekend announcement by Chinese authorities failed to provide ...

item.title: Dollar Keeps Rising As Fed Is Expected To Cut Cautiously
item.description: The dollar extended last week’s gains as markets expect the Fed to keep a gradual pace of interest rate cuts, broadly supporting the greenback.

item.title: B. Riley’s stock soars 30% after bank agrees to sell Great American to Oaktree for almost $400 million
item.description: Investment bank’s stock is down 73% in the year to date amid regulatory fallout over a loan

item.title: General Motors says Barclays will replace Goldman Sachs as rewards-card issuer starting next summer

item.title: ‘He views me as an outsider’: My partner has signs of dementia. He’s already spent $750,000. How can I stop him from wiping us out?
item.description: “Some of these expenditures were along the lines of ‘Guess what I bought today?’ bad surprises.”

item.title: U.S. Stocks Trade Mixed
